input: can you please clarify the service rate here?
gold_answer:
The service rates for single-family residences in the City of Piedmont are based on the size of the garbage cart. The rates for curbside collection are as follows: $94.76 per month for a 20-gallon garbage cart, $100.41 per month for a 35-gallon garbage cart, $138.33 per month for a 65-gallon garbage cart, and $154.91 per month for a 95-gallon garbage cart. Each residential account includes unlimited recycling and organics carts. On-premises (backyard) collection rates are different and are limited to a maximum size of 35 gallons. Additional garbage carts are available for an additional cost.
For residents of Madison County, NY, there is no charge for residential yard waste drop-off if the items are up to 6 inches in diameter and no longer than 10 feet in length. Commercial yard waste, stumps, and oversized tree limbs are charged per ton and must go over the scales before unloading.

retrieved_contexts.text:
FAQs - City of Piedmont

To receive the discount, the account holder must fill out the application for exemption to curbside placement of carts, provide a doctor's certification that the customer is unable to move the carts to the curb or provide a copy of a valid California Disability Placard, and verify that there are no able-bodied household members that can move the carts to the curb.

Service Rates for Single Family Residences

Q. What are the Service Rates for Single Family Residences?

A. Single family residential prices are based on the size of the garbage cart. Each residential account includes unlimited recycling and organics carts. Carts used for on-premises (backyard) services are limited to a maximum size of 35 gallons. Additional garbage carts are available for an additional cost.

Curbside Collection:

20 Gallon Garbage Cart - $94.76 per month
35 Gallon Garbage Cart - $100.41 per month
65 Gallon Garbage Cart - $138.33 per month
95 Gallon Garbage Cart - $154.91 per month

Residential Rates Effective July 1, 2023 - Curbside Service

On-Premises (Backyard) Collection:

20 Gallon Garbage Cart - $145 per month
35 Gallon Garbage Cart - $150.65 per month

Backyard Rates Effective July 1, 2023 - Back Yard Service
(Limited to 20 or 35 gallon carts ONLY for worker safety)

Interested in Organics Recycling (Composting)?

Q. What goes in the Green Organics Cart?

A. Yard trimmings, food scraps and food soiled paper. All items must fit within the cart with the lid completely closed. This includes twigs and branches. Click here to view Organics Recycling details.

Q. What doesn't belong in the Green Organics Cart?

A. All plastics (including bags and flower pots), all glass and metal, pet waste, diapers, treated or coated wood, trash, hazardous waste and rocks (dirt, concrete and sand).

Q. I just completed a yard clean-up. How do I dispose of all the yard debris that does not fit in my Green Organics Cart?

Yard Waste	

As of January 1, 2020, there is a charge for commercial yard waste drop-off. All commercial yard waste must go to 6641 Buyea Road, Canastota and go over the scales before unloading.Residential Yard Waste No Charge for items up to 6 inches in diameter and no longer than 10 feet in length. Bring to any of the 4 transfer stations and see an attendant before unloading.Commercial Yard Waste, Buyea Road ONLY $25.00 per ton, must go over the scales before unloading.Stumps and Oversized Tree Limbs, Buyea Road ONLY$35.00 per ton, must go over the scales before unloading.
